description: After walking around SF on a summer afternoon, this hit the spot. Cool and refreshing. It was quiet on a weekday afternoon. I found a seat in the atrium to sit with my fro yo. I love the self serve idea. I purchase as much or as little as I would like of as many flavors I want to enjoy. The watermelon flavor stood out to me and I wanted to try that. It was sweet and not tart. The lychee flavor is tart. The mochi bites topped off my dessert. Yummy!
author: Julie S.

description:
First thing I noticed upon walking in was that this place uses not only posters with self serve Froyo instructions that are from Tutti Frutti, even with the logo still attached, but also, uses Titti Frutti names for their yogurt flavors, like Death by Chocolate and others. Interesting..

We asked to sample their only vegan flavor and the woman working there sampled us cups that had nothing more than just a drop of yogurt in them. I had no idea if I liked what I tried or what it even was because it was such a bare amount. 

She was speaking on her cellphone during this encounter, and we could obviously hear her very personal conversation which was not business related. 

I asked if I could try one of their topping flavors and she rudely told me that it's not allowed, WHILE STILL TALKING ON HER CELLPHONE. 

We left immediately.
author: Anna A.

description:
Got some froyo while waiting for my table at Marafuku. There is a $5 min on credit cards, but they chrage a bit higher than most places per ounce, so it's not that hard to go over the min.

Biggest downside is the variety. Pretty basic selection of flavors and not any interesting toppings. The best topping, however, is the Fruity Pebbles!
author: Vasiliy M.

description: Service is HORRIBLE! And fro-yo was expensive. The fro-yo itself wasn't bad but they don't like you tasting it
author: Sabrina K.

description:
Place - in the Japan center, choices are not as many as other frozen yogurt shop. There are not cheese cake and brownie topping :( There are many tables out of store.

Taste - most flavors are pretty good. I liked original one and lychee one. Toppings were simple and not many choice. Not thing special but not bad. 

Price - reasonable price. 

Service - They don't accept credit card under $5. They don't provide sample small cup for tring taste of frozen yogurt.
author: Da Won L.

description: Who doesn't like self-serve froyo? The guy trying to get it to go only to find out that they don't have to go lids. WTF! This ain't Italy!!
author: Eric J.

description: Really convenient froyo place located right in the Japantown plaza mall. They have a small selection (~8) flavors of froyo plus a decent selection of toppings. I tried their matcha froyo which was decent -- it had a pretty strong bitter tea flavor that was offset with the slight sweetness from the froyo, but it wasn't particularly memorable. If I remember correctly, price was about 59 centers per ounce. $5 minimum for credit cards.
author: Alvin W.

description:
#91/2016

Eight different flavors of frozen yogurt make it hard to decide which ones you'll choose: Matcha green tea, blueberry, chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, lychee and more. 

Rich, creamy and sinfully decadent, this frozen yogurt definitely tastes a step above. 

Then the real choices start: the toppings. I've never seen such a wide selection from lots of fresh fruit (pineapple, kiwi, strawberries, blueberries, cherries) to a rainbow assortment of candies (mini rice Krispy treat bars, peanut butter cups, white and dark chocolate pieces, M&Ms and a lot more).

I missed the Ghirardelli caramel sauce - and that's  a good thing!

Do yourself a favor and grab the small cup because by the time I was ready to pay, even though I thought I hadn't gone overboard, the  price was sticker shock.

Despite that, the value was there so it only stung for the moment I paid. 

MoYo's Froyo is super clean, too. My inner Mrs. Meyers approved.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Decent typical frozen yogurt ! 
Not as many flavor choices as other places. They do provide sample cups so don't forget to ask! Their lychee flavor was yum!

Nice consistency, creamy & not watery. 

Very small shopfront, you must find seating elsewhere outside in the plaza. I prefer to walk and eat anyway though :p
author: Angela C.

description: Love it!!! Super yummy Froyo place that is self serve! Like the ones I used to go to in NY! They have fresh fruit and mochi to add. They have like 6 flavors of Froyo including tarte, chocolate, Matcha. It's inside a mall and there's sitting there as well
author: Isabel P.

description:
Amazing selection of flavors and toppings! 
I love going to Moyo because they always have new flavors and classics to try! My favorites are Lychee, Strawberry and classic tart, each one is so good! They also have one of the best selection of toppings I've ever seen! The fruit is fresh and their Mochi is soft and fresh too! They also have cereal and my favorite popping boba topping! This froyo place is also so clean every time I visit! Nothing but good things here!
author: Larissa S.

description:
I was hoping that they would have their matcha froyo today but they didn't. So I tried the French vanilla froyo and watermelon sorbet today. And I was surprised how much I liked the watermelon sorbet. It tastes so refreshing especially on a warm day like today. I also had the lychee jelly, cherries, mixed mochi, and popping lychee balls. I highly recommend the watermelon sorbet! 

There is a $5 minimum on credit/debit card purchases.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Another typical Self-Serve yogurt. the taste is pretty standard from other places and it's nothing unique. They do have some different flavors but it's a bit too sweet for my taste (I think it was the caramel popcorn or something like that; couldn't tell but it was very sweet) If you want self serve yogurt this is the place to go, else I wouldn't make a special trip for it.
author: Eric T.

description: This is some surprisingly good froyo in the Japantown plaza, and it makes for a nice place to shop in between all the shopping and browsing you'll do here. Though they don't offer sample cups, they always have somewhat interesting flavors--on my most recent visit, I had the tart, chocolate, pomegranate, and mango, and all of them were delicious! I was especially surprised by how good the pomegranate and mango fruit flavors were--they didn't taste artificial, but were light, clean, and just slightly tart. The toppings bar is also extensive, so you can have your pick--the prices aren't cheap, but this is certainly a great place for a quick, cool snack!
author: David K.

description: Didn't actually try anything but the cashier was a dirtbag. I asked for a couple of sample cups- she refused. I don't ask for much in life, but I would like to sample more than ONE flavor, I'm terrible at decision making.
author: Brittany H.

description:
This place is really good and affordable.
They have good fruity flavors but lack fresh fruit toppings. If you're like me and enjoy all the fufu toppings (gummy, mochi, cereal, etc) then you came to the right place. Frozen yogurt is always good especially sharing
author: Camille B.

description:
I am actually surprised by the high rating of this place. At first glance, it is nothing impressive. Just your typical Asian froyo joint, but even more expensive than Yogurtland at 49cents/ounce (according to previous reviews, this number seems to be forever increasing). 

There is a worker who holds the key to the samples. You have to ask her to sample each flavor, and only then, does she give you a teensy bit. No complaints though, at least there are even samples. 

After a while, all the flavors kinda taste the same. They were super sweet and a bit too icy and not as creamy as I would've liked. Green tea and tart were my faves. 

They offer a good variety of toppings, but I wish the chocolate toppings were broken into smaller pieces. There were WHOLE Twix/KitKat/etc. bars as "toppings"... 

I only came here because I really wanted froyo and this was the only place around in the plaza. Sad.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Yums taro flavor! Couldn't really taste the green tea even when I super-channeled my focus.

One tasting cup at a time served by a lady who was mopping the floor at the same time, seemed kind of inefficient and also a little weird to me, but then again they only have like 8 flavors.
author: Tian Q.

description:
MoYo's Froyo is nice if you want a lower-calorie dessert alternative to the other offerings in the Japantown mall area (such as crepes and ice cream), but I've definitely had better.

This is the first froyo place my husband and I have ever visited where there were neither sample cups nor some equivalent (we once visited a place in Boston that didn't have sample cups, but the owners were gracious enough to let us try out their apple pie flavor by putting a dollop on a spoon). My wife, who has an insatiable sweet tooth when it comes to frozen yogurt, therefore decided not to commit herself to her usual pound of froyo and just tried a few ounces.

The flavor selection is decent. On top of the usual selection (chocolate, vanilla), there was also, if memory serves me, caramel popcorn and matcha green tea. The caramel popcorn was a little too sweet and the flavor of the caramel was overpowering, but the matcha green tea was probably the best we've had among the dozens of froyo stores and chains we've visited over the years. It was wondrously creamy, and the matcha flavor tasted authentic--I would believe you if you said it was made with real matcha powder, and if not, whatever alternative artificial flavoring was used was extremely convincing and didn't taste at all artificial! It was on par with green tea ice cream!

I'm not sure if we'll be back next time we drop by Japantown. If they rotate flavors (having only gone once, I'm not sure if they do that, or how frequently), we might very well try it out, but there are also lots of other tempting dessert options in the area!
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
The chubby girl with glasses named Carla is a total BITCH.  I usually give very generous reviews but this person does not belong in a customer service position.  They have a rule of only 2 samples per person which is ridiculous because there are several different flavors and I wanted to try another flavor before I buy it.  They said only 2 samples allowed per person and I made a comment that I have never heard of a froyo place having a max of 2 samples and that this was ridiculous.  

With such terrible customer service this place won't be around for long.  Carla is a Terrible person and I would never ever support this business ever. Carla spoke back to me in a VERY RUDE manner and practically berated me.  I'm sorry but if you're in the service industry and want to keep customers you should NEVER ever talk to them in such a terrible manner.  

There are MANY other frozen yogurt places where I would rather spend my money.  I highly suggest you don't waste your time or money here.  If you read the other reviews there are several other people who had the same terrible service I did.  Do not waste your time or money here.  Trust me.
author: Christine P.

description: Review is for the non-existent service. Yogurt is not bad and it's the only self service yogurt shop in the area. But guess what, Mo-Jo employees, kindness and a smile don't cost a thing. All the employees are very dismissive, one time I had to interrupt the employee from watching a foreign soap opera in a back to get a sample cup. And then they stand there and watch you get the sample. Kinda awkward IMO. I'd rather pay more and go to Frache three blocks away on Filmore St, pricier but still worth it.
author: Daniella O.

description:
Basically a Tutti Frutti (there was even a tutti frutti sign on the wall here!) with less flavors. I got the raspberry pomegranate + lychee with sprinkes; the flavors were very sweet, and the lychee tasted almost flavorless. Its froyo is nothing special.

TIP: try the samples.
author: Ella C.

description:
Really nice little spot for frozen yogurt in the mall.  Pretty much self-serve, you pay by the final weight of your creation.  Not a ton of flavors, only about six I think.  My preferred options are the original, lychee, green tea, and mango flavors.  

Toppings are pretty extensive.  Off the top of my head, I remember they have m&ms, lychee, mochi, chocolate chips, twix, cookie straws, and many more.  I love stopping here.  Definitely give it a shot.
author: Lars T.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST FRO-YO PLACE EVER EVeR eVER!!!!!!

This is definitely the "PREMIUM" fro-yo it advertised itself to be! Its plain tart as well as lychee were AMAZINGLY delicious!

It is slightly pricey - comes out as 44cents per ounce. However, it is absolutely yummy and I highly HIGHLY recommend this place!
author: Maria G.

description: I had three flavors. The best flavor is the Salted Carmel Popcorn! I know it sounds weird for a flavor, but it has a strong good taste of salted Carmel like that of Bi-rite's salted Carmel ice cream. The next best one is the strong flavor Pumpkin which was nice. It had a few black dots to show nutmeg I am guessing. The green tea has the weakest flavor of all. The boba balls or pop pop some of you call them, I was a bit disappointed in the texture which was too soft for my taste and I couldn't tell when the ball exploded because I couldn't taste the flavors of the juice and I couldn't tell when the ball burst. Of course this is just my subjective point of view. And for you, your experience may be different.  But I am just comparing with it with my first experience with a boba ball in a fro-yo shop. I have had better. The best way to judge if fro-yo tastes good is to limit your toppings so that you can really taste the fro yo yourself. Added toppings always makes everything tastes good.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Hands down my favorite non-yogurt farms yogurt place!!!!!!!!
Nestled in japan town, this place was hoping every time we walked by.
Because of that, we decided we had to try, and I am so glad we did!

The staff were smiling, friendly and attentive.
The yogurts were flavors I'd never seen anywhere else! Taro= amazing.
BUT the creme de la creme were the toppings ....
They had these balls called pop pops, which were like a tapioca outside with a cold burst of juice when you bit into them.
They also had fresh lychees, almond jelly and a great assortment of fruits.

I just wish this place was closer!!!
author: Leah S.

description:
This was a wonderful dessert option in the Japantown mall area, especially when the other sweet treat shops were overly crowded in the aftermath of the Ramen Festival. 

Yogurtland will remain my favorite froyo spot, but I was pleasantly surprised by the flavors at MoYo's. There were around 8 different FLAVORS, ranging from tart fruity choices (plain, mango, blueberry, etc.) to more indulgent creamy ones (chocolate, vanilla, coffee, etc.). My froyo philosophy is to always go for the fruit flavors because they just taste better in froyo form. And the plain flavor is nothing plain -- very light, refreshing, and just the right amount of acidity. The texture of all the flavors are very smooth.

What really won me over were the abundant TOPPING CHOICES -- lots of fruit, different mochis, candies galore, various cookies (including whole madeleines), and my favorite...jellies! Like the little jellies you get in boba drinks. My favorites are the coffee jellies and lychee bubbles.

There was a line but it moved speedily along. The layout of the store allows you to loop around to get your froyo before paying at the cashier. I love efficiency!

Although the price is a teeny bit more expensive (~ $0.39 / oz.), everything tastes great and I would come back again when I'm in the area.

Come grab a bowl of froyo and enjoy it in the mall or out in Peace Plaza!
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
MoYo's Froyo is inside the Kintetsu Building (now just called the West Buidling) in San Francisco's Japan town (Nihon Machi) center. 

It is a PYOFY place (Pour Your Own FroYo) with several machines, and thus several flavors. 

Nothing remarkable about the FroYo, except that it is really the only PYOFY FroYo place between here and Pacific Heights. 

I am assuming that MoYo might be a chopped and merged name that is popular in Japan with stars. 

A lot of people here in the US think that P. Diddy naming J.Lo was the first to do this type of branding. But actually, a long time ago in Japan, they were doing this, with popular stars like KimiTaku  (Actor, Singer, former SMAP Boy Band heart throb Kimura Takuya). 

So MoYo could be someone like Morita Yoji or something like that. Who knows?

When I came in here recently, there was a little CosPlay (Costume Play) Anime (Animation) event happening in the J-Town center later, so the girl working behind the counter had her cute Anime CosPlay outfit on, which is perfect for a FroYo place that is PYOFY, regardless of if you are J.Lo or KimiTaku. I couldn't tell if she was real, Caucasian, Asian, or what!

Makes you want to make a V with the fingers on both hands, smile, and take a picture, and later draw graphics all around it! 

FroYo Wanugee here, you know you love me!
author: Wanugee N.

description:
I love the flavors here... especially lychee, taro & green tea froyo.  They had kumquat flavor yesterday, but I didn't try it.
The mochi topping & flavored bubbles are great too.
They have a card that you can get stamped to work towards a free yogurt.
I have always found the employees here to be nice on my several visits!
author: P P.

description:
Let me just state once and for all that whoever said one froyo shop is like every other is...well, probably right. Aren't they pretty much the same except maybe like Yoppi which has a calorific creaminess you know moves it more into gelato territory? For froyo aficionados, MoYo's is yet another Pinkberry knockoff by way of Tutti Frutti in the blind corner of what passes for a food court of the Japan Center's Kintetsu Mall (the one with the Benihana in it). It's next door to the previously confused sweets shop, Cafe Hana. 

For the people who do come here, MoYo's probably overdue because you can frankly eat only so many crepes at Sophie's or Belly Good (...geez, I hate that name). It's the familiar self-service spigot concept - which always makes me cringe a bit since who knows what people do when they have direct access to a spigot. Trying to move beyond my phobia, I tried a cup of Strawberry Fields (no sugar) with a dollop of Cappuccino and some insensible mix of toppings (see photo). Man, where are the pecans? Nice, courteous owner, but what else do you expect in Japantown? 

FROYO - 3 stars...if you've tried one spigot, you've...you get the picture 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...ambiance? 
SERVICE - 3 stars...well, it is self-service after all 
TOTAL - 3 stars...if you are crepe'd out
author: Ed U.

description:
YAY 4 Green Tea froyo! Even though I had some froyo yesterday, as soon as I spotted the green tea froyo flavor sign, I did a double take and then happily skipped into the little froyo shoppe. (Okay maybe I didn't skip, but I imagined myself doing so.

FROYO
-What would have made me ACTUALLY skip was if they had a Green Tea *TART* flavor! But no biggie, I put my creative juices to use and mixed their Green Tea flavor (it tastes just like green tea icecream, I highly recommend if you love matcha flavored desserts. I just particularly like my green tea froyo to be tart ;)) with their regular Original Tart flavor. So yummmm! 
-They also had a Lychee flavor which I did not get to try. Next time!
-Lots of topping choices - candies, fruit, cereal, etc.
-45cents/ounce. Not super cheap, but cheaper than Easy Breezy. I wish there was a high demand in Froyo here in SF to drive down these prices. I've had it twice in two days now... froyo is just so good! AM I RIGHT?!
author: Grace J.

description:
Fro-yo can be dangerous on your pocket 
If you're sweet on this treat.
Even in San Francisco when you don't need to beat the heat.

There are eight flavors of frozen yogurt and plenty of toppings.
Full pieces of candy, syrups, fruit and chocolate chips.
Forget what they said about a moment on the lips.

The smallest bowl is huge, enough for two to eat.
Before you fill it up with goodies and are cashier bound. 
Remember its pay by the pound.
author: Kristi G.

description: Totally over this place after the bitch working here asked me if I actually planned on buying yogurt when I asked her if I could get a sample. UM WHAT? Never again. Blacklisted.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Located inside the mall in Japantown. Good variety of traditional and asian froyo flavors and toppings. Love them all. 

They may have had some healthier feeling and tart flavors but in general this is pretty sweet froyo. I love it. The green tea was a little creamier and less sweet. 

Self serve and moderately priced.
author: Angela K.

description:
Taro, mango, strawberry, lychee and green tea

After sampling taro, strawberry, lychee, green tea and mango I liked taro the most. Green tea didn't have enough flavor in it, the strawberry was so and so. Lychee was a bit tarty for me and the mango wasn't strong enough in flavor. The taro tasted the most authentic. The yogurt was smooth and not too icy and it didn't melt right away. Plus, 45cents an oz, you can't go wrong!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
My notes: 
45 cents an ounce - a bit pricey
Taro and green tea were my highlights; plain tart and lychee were just OK. Tutti frutti brand froyo (a chain, competitor of Yogurtland) is expectedly creamy, less icy, but not over milky.
Highlight was lots of toppings including whole brownies, lots of types of chocolate candies, including kit kats; mochi was fresh and chewy in small balls. Fruit was fresh -- not thawed. 
Ask an employee for samples.

Would go back when my froyo craving hits in Japantown-- and the line at Sophie's or Belly is way too long for a gelato crepe!
author: Debora L.

description: Fro-yo texture and flavor is good, especially if you like soft-serve. Too bad they don't let you sample yourself!
author: C M.

description:
ok i don't even know where to start but let me say every time i come to sf japan town this is the place to go to for my fro yo. my very first experience coming here was about 2011. i remember i was with my friends and at that time fro yo was a big hit in the city and in sac as well. i knew at that time i loved to go try different places for fro yo. 

welp 4 yrs ago we came to sf japan town to visit because my friends love it here a lot and we all decided we want fro yo. so we walked in and i saw that its not these ordinary classic boring flavors. i mean when i saw the matcha green tea flavor, my eyes popped out big at that time. i didn't even sample and just went ahead and find the biggest size cup they had and filled that baby up and then next i went and looked at the toppings and somehow fruity pebbles go sooooo good with any flavor and it just gives the fro yo the extra crisp texture. next i always love the plain mochi for the extra chewyness! and at that time they had popping bobas which is shaped like a tapioca and are the same size and when you bite into them the juices pop out. when i knew they had all my favorite things i was in sweet heaven and this become my favorite spot. 

Ever since that experience i have made it a habit whenever i come to japan town, i knew i had to stop by here and get some of their fro yo and my flavor of course will be the matcha green tea. so the other day i came here for the cherry blossom festival and i made sure i came here to have some. i also have a friend who doesn't like the franchise or name brand fro yo such as pink berry or big spoon and she loves little fro yo shops like this and of course i had to show her my spot. my friends all tried it and loved every single bit of their fro yo. 

ok so why i love their matcha green tea flavor so much because it does taste like green tea and isn't too sweet or bitter. its very creamy and natural flavors not too artificial. i really love their recipe to it, i can totally have that every day too. also the flavor is very refreshing and feels light. it settles good in the tummy. also after eating this particular fro yo i don't feel guilty where i want to go tot he gym and burn it off quick lol.... i just love it, and prefer this any day over other fro yo shops and am willing to pay for it too. i spent under 4 bucks for fro yo so its about same price as pink berry which i had a day before this place too so i definitely can say i am updated to price and quality. 

the people who work here is also friendly and polite and patient as well. i think good customer service is the way to go. also they have plenty of seating inside the mall outside the shop and finding a spot to sit wasn't a problem. will be back soon!
author: Alex T.

description: Wish there were more non-fat/fat-free flavors to choose from! I went with green tea (non-fat), salted caramel corn (low-fat), and vanilla (sugar-free and extremely creamy, so highly unlikely that this was low in fat!) and went a little crazy on the toppings. I'm happy with the topping selection as well, but I wish the candy bars were broken up into smaller pieces. It's kinda hard to enjoy my froyo with a whole twix bar or reese's pieces or rice krispy treat, which by the way is an excellent topping if crushed up. And finally the cashier was super unpleasant. She looked ready to bite my head off when I asked for a sample... Oops.
author: Shawna C.

description: Very good and cheap. I like tarot flavor.
author: Cécile D.

description:
Let's be frank. Froyo is Froyo and I have yet to discovered a shop that contradicts my analogy. Moyo's is no different. Your A-OK Froyo shop with the standard topping selections. 

This shop serves up [only] 8 different flavors to choose from.
- Mango
- Tart
- Papaya
- Strawberry Fields
- Green Tea
- Lychee
- Death by Chocolate
- Taro

.. I confess, I only really came here for the mochi and gummi bears. [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/y6ba1CM1EDEaIg5cVIhXCQ/l.jpg]
author: Albert L.

description:
They have the best asian flavors!!!
Lychee, Taro, and Green Tea! Need I say more?!?!  Really good lychee frozen yogurt! 
Definitley recommend if you like asian flavors :)
Fresh fruits and all the normal toppings are avaliable as well.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Moyo seemed sweet and innocent at first, but my encounter was nothing of the sort. 

My girlfriend and I wanted to sample some flavors before we bought, so we asked if we could and some short, chubby girl with glasses got the sample cups ready. 

I asked for green tea, and she gave us just a bit - barely any in the sample cup and definitely  not skimming the top of the miniature cup. My girlfriend tasted it and then handed it to me like we always do. It was passable for froyo.

Then she asked for lychee and we did our tasting, and it was Ok. 

I asked to taste the sea salt caramel, and the girl said we couldn't have any more tastings. I said that there are two of us, isn't it two tastings per person? She said we both tasted each one so that was already four tastings. Wtf?? 

What kind of cheap ass place is this? I've never felt so belittled because she pointed to us and said, you tasted some, and you tasted some, no more. 

Wow, I haven't written a Yelp review in almost 6 years, but felt compelled to write this one based on such a horrible experience. 

Never would I spend a dime at this establishment.
author: Eric L.

description: Great flavors, incl. matcha (green tea) frozen yogurt, but surprisingly minimal options for toppings that are obstructively larger than Halloween sized portions instead of crushed to be maximized throughout all the froyo. A tad bit disappointing given that it's also hard to find (tip: enter off Buchanan street into the "west" shopping plaza").
author: Regina D.

description: This is a regular froyo place, but it has the highly-delicious GREEN TEA FROYO. This stuff tastes like crack. I don't know how it tastes so good, but oh man.
author: Ross L.

description:
Moyo's is literally a corner froyo place (inside the mall). no seating at all. white walls with a slice of kiwi and orange decor.

froyo availability:
-guava: nice guava taste and tart
-lychee very slight lichee taste, some tartness
-green tea: slight green tea taste, not full bodied
-original tart
-strawberry field: slight strawberry taste
-mango delight
-cookies & cream
-tarobly licious

pricing:  self serve,  .43 cents, froyo & toppings, 18 dry toppings of chocolates, gummies, mochis, nuts, cereals, and candies in trays.
15 wet toppings (4 yogurt poppers, 6ish fruit, canned cherry, jellies, and crumbled cookies) in trays. blueberries were mushy and previously frozen, mochi chewy.

frodrips:
-wellspring froyo machines, customized karat laminated cups
-froyo is diluted tutti frutti versions,(not representative of present turri quality).  froyo texture creamy to icy
-wacky wabbit wating: 1 stars. mikey: "froyo s....s" "cashier is chinese, not japanese.."
-only 32 cups available. samples given, just a splat though.
-there's better froyo out there not too far awwwayyy...
author: Victor G.

description: The flavors here are pretty good. There's only 6 but they're tasty. The cup sizes are pretty average, a little bigger than the ones I see when I get frozen yogurt. There aren't too many topping either. The price is a bit more than I thought it would be. But the employee seemed nice.
author: Emily L.

description:
As a dire yogurtland fan, I was hesitant to try any Moyo froyo yogurt.   Stepping into Moyo's Froyo, I was felt somewhat ashamed to even think about trying something other than yogurtland but at the end it was worth it.  Moyo's Froyo offers different yogurt plate and their toppings were simply great~!! At the end, I learned that my legion to yogurtland is not tarnished where I can enjoy other yogurt establishments.   

Food:  A
Service: A
Overall:  A

ps. Try the taro yogurt and their mochi~!!
author: Izzy H.

description: Love this place. They have pretty delicious tropical flavors like passionfruit, mango and lychee. I really love combining their mango and original tart. They have a good selection of toppings including fruity pebbles (my favorite). It's open till late on weekends too.
author: Alexa N.

description:
Original. Green Tea. Lychee. The best froyo flavors I tried. I also tried Pistachio but it was really artificial tasting.

I used to work at a froyo store and lemme say this - it was a froyo store with great quality. 

The three flavors I've mentioned are INDEED, comparable to my standards.

Lots of toppings. The fruit toppings were a bit... huge though. Like, the pieces weren't cut super small so it was a bit of a turn off. But I can appreciate the option to add mini sour gummy worms. LOL.

It's a self-serve froyo place that calculates how much you pay based on WEIGHT... So you can see where I'm going with the size of the fruit and how it was cut into pretty big pieces... Maybe I'm just used to getting more bang for my buck or something.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Used to be a regular here.  Had frequent flyer card, etc.  But recent poor customer service experience put me off and they're off my list.

Had a few tastes and then bought 3 orders for my family.   Decided after a cup of coffee that I wanted some too.  Went back in (while family is still eating the 3 orders in front of the store) to taste what I wanted, but was rejected because we went over the 'limit' of free tastes.

I understand the limit of abusing free tastes, but we tasted in order to buy.  I just bought three and you know I was going to buy another....pissed me off, so I left and they will not get me back for tastes or purchases.
author: No B.

description: It's good but hella expensive. The lady there pissed me off. Ok so, I'm a person with little money and we paid it with quarters and dimes and she was like. "I can't do that next time" and I'm here like, I'm counting the coins not you. this was 4:13 pm on June 16,2016
author: _sarah C.

description: Stopped in here for a tasty dessert and wasn't too impressed.  There was something strange about the yogurt, another reviewer said it was sour ... that might be what I was tasting. I had chocolate yogurt with candy toppings that kind of tasted stale.  I think I'll look for another place to get dessert while I'm in town this weekend.
author: Nicole B.

description:
MoYo's Froyo is a good option if you need your fix and you're in Japantown. The flavors and toppings add up to a more Asian-friendly flavor profile, but that's not a bad thing, and it's arguably quite appropriate given the location. The price is appropriate, and the yogurt is nicely cold and creamy. 

There aren't that many toppings relative to other places in the city, but what there are look quite fresh and good. On one stop here I saw one of the counter staff slicing up mangos and strawberries in the back so I can verify that their fruit is super fresh! The flavors they offer up skew pretty heavily toward fruit flavors, but I've found that some of their flavors are bit... off. I love their No Sugar Added Strawberry, their Original Tart, and their Vanilla, but their Chocolate is a bit chalky, and their Taro tasted too much like root vegetable and not enough like sugar. 

So to sum it up: if you want the best Moyo's has to offer, load up on their fruit toppings and go for a light accompaniment of vanilla or original tart yogurt.
author: Aaron Y.

description:
The girl on duty is very nice. Taro and Chocolate flavors are my favorite. I topped it with brownie bites, m&m's, oreo cookies, kit kat and sprinkles. Everything here are all under $10, very affordable. If you are looking something quick, delicious, and tasty then look no further than Moyo's Froyo in Japantown!

4/29/2013:

Today was a hot day so I came in for a cold treat to beat the heat.

Strawberry Banana flavored frozen yogurt with bits of Oreo cookies - tempting and delicious

I did notice the score they have posted up, they scored a perfect 100 as a health score from the health inspector. This score indicated to me and other customers that the staff working here keeps the store looking clean and tidy. Positive experience here so I am definitely coming again for my frozen yogurt cravings.
author: Bennett W.

description: Moyo's Froyo lies right at the center of the mall where it is surrounded by other bakeries and stores. After a quick shop in the stores nearby, a quick sweet fix at Moyo's fulfills the japantown visit. I usually choose caramel/chocolate flavors, but today I decided to try the fruitier flavors. I got the peach, strawberry, and lychee froyo. Then I topped it off with lychee, white chocolate chips, fruit like bubbles, and mochi bites. The price is decent. If you're not frugal with the choices and want to try a little bit of everything like what I did, the price comes out to be in the $5 range. The flavor really goes well with the warm San Francisco weather. The shopping center could be a little warmer on a sunny day, so the froyo definitely helped out with the temperature. The lychee, although really heavy, complimented the froyo really well. I will no doubt return and try a different flavor or topping next time.
author: Samantha W.

description: I came here with my fiancée and tried out out their Mango and Green tea flavors topped with lychee,mango jelly pop pops, strawberries and gummy bears. It was super delicious!!! Their customer service and enviroment was really good. I'm soo coming back to this place on my birthday week vacation next month. I don't know about you guys but I loved this place!!
author: Nancy L.

description: This place is located in the Japan Center. I really liked it. Haven't been to a lot of fro-yo places, but I liked the yogurt flavors (lychee, taro, etc) and the toppings (pop-ops/bobba, candy, fruit, sauces, etc). It's a small area and you can sit outside in the mall after you get it. Good stuff, actually stopped by twice while I was in the mall!
author: Cassandra F.

description:
This is a solid froyo place, with only a few things that distinguish it from the pack.
#1 They have these toppings that are gelatin on the outside and that burst with lychee or mango flavor inside.
#2 and more importantly - there is this amazing guy who is a sommelier of yogurt - of sorts - he guides you through the samples with these descriptions that will TICKLE YOUR FANCY. Have him describe lychee yogurt and the way it feels gliding down your throat and you'll be mesmerized. It's unreal. 
I will go back for this sample guy - he needs to be honored in some really important way.
author: Andrew K.

description:
In a pinch, MoYo's is totally fine. The prices are reasonable, the topping bar is surprisingly varied, but the yogurt is just pretty good. It's not great, but it's worth a shot if you're really craving frozen yogurt in Japantown.

As for any kind of hospitality, it is what it is. When I went, there was one guy working and hey, he did his job. Nothing special, but it's not like there's a whole lot for him to help people with anyway.

The pistachio flavor was my favorite, along with some colorful, sweet "pop-pop" pieces on top (which are something like tiny Gushers, if Gushers tasted like something real).
author: Jiordan C.

description: I really love frozen yogurt. I alway look for a new shop. Moyo is the one of my choice. There are many flavors ; lychee , original, chocolate , mango!!  I ate mango flavor with  caramel and mango topping . Very yummy!!!
author: Natty Y.

description:
I'm determined to become Duke of this place because it's so cute. Smack dab in the middle of the Japan Center in Japantown, it's the best place for froyo in the neighborhood outside of Fraiche in the Fillmore. 

The place is tucked away in the middle of the Japan Center next to the Andersen's Bakery and Cako (on the other side), so it might be a scavenger hunt to find the place. But, once there, it's your simple, usual froyo shop.

Not that many flavors to choose from (I think there's a total of 8 or 10) and the toppings are the usual toppings. My favorite are the "pop-pops" ... little balls that contain flavored gel/liquid inside that upon biting or applying pressure with your tongue, pops in your mouth with an explosion of flavor. I think this is one of few places you can safely say "pops in your mouth with an explosion of flavor" and get away with it.

Here's to Duke-ing this place!
author: Mike N.

description:
Mango- BEST
Lychee- good, its sweet and creamy
Taro- tooooo sweet!
Chocolate- if you love chocolate, you'll LOVE this
Blueberry- a bit tart, but its pretty good
Strawberry splenda- goood with the mango
green tea- very creamy

overall this place is pretty good. all their froyo is very smooth. its just a bit dark inside.
author: Erica L.

description: Mmmmmm, froyo. I only had the original but it's nice and tart. The fruit toppings are fresh and the staff are pretty friendly. At $0.39/oz, it's on the cheaper side of DIY froyo places.
author: Josephine L.

description: Death By Chocolate + Cappuccino + Strawberries and Pop Boba + Extraordinarily Helpful Froyo Guy = A DELICIOUS FROYO MOCHA
author: Amy C.

description: my favorite watermelon froyo spot ever! the other flavors are like any other froyo spots like yogurtland, pinkberry, etc.. but their watermelon flavor is THE best. You must try it!
author: Julie L.

description: Their salted caramel popcorn flavor is to die for!!! So yummy.
author: Bri R.

description:
Shop Decor/Location: Cute; Nestled in between all the fun quirky, lil shops in the Japantown shopping center

Price: They charge by weight/it's self-serve.  A bit expensive at 45/cents an ounce (i consider 0.40 cents or less "reasonable/cheap" because i know these places exist)

Customer service/atmosphere: Ehh, okay. Granted there isn't much to "serve the customer" (since it's a DIY-kinda place). But also, I didnt like that if you wanted to sample, you had to have one of the employees get the sample for you. I felt like I was being "watched/judged" if (and i did...)sample more than 1.  Also, the samples given were very stingy.

Quality of yogurt/flavors: Tried their mango(good), lychee tart (too tart/not enough "lychee-ness" for me), and green apple (good). Ended up getting the mango, green apple and "death by chocolate" (which i didnt dare to "try" for fear of looking too cheap...)flavor. All were good, but nothing undone before.

(*FYI-lychee tastes more "lychee-y" as of 3/25=))
author: G L.

description:
Came here yesterday for fro yo with friends after dinner. The froyo and toppings were good, (Taro was yum!) but I was kind of weirded out that the guy working behind the counter wouldn't let us get our own tasting. He was REALLY strict about that. It was a big turn off since there wasn't anyone else there, no need to be so intense, ya know?

Meh - it was good but the guy was too intense...it's just froyo!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
I love frozen yogurt so I am very picky about my froyo. I hate runny yogurt, too powdery, and very artificial tasting froyo. MoYo's frozen yogurt is the opposite of all of that. It almost tasted like ice cream, but still had that tangy flavor of frozen yogurt. My favorites were the tart, taro, mango, and green tea. 

Now I wish I didn't live so far from Japantown.
author: Tif L.

description:
After shopping at Nijiya Sunday evening, my dad was craving ice cream so we took him here for fro-yo.  The staff was super nice today and for some reason, the bill for three was $13 instead of the $20+ that it was last time, perhaps because we didn't indulge in any toppings this time.

I had the Strawberry (no sugar) and also Death by Chocolate.  The Strawberry was really good, way better than I expected after seeing the sugar notation.  Next time, I'll have a lot more of that one.

Close to the Auto Freak store too.

Nice place, conveniently located.  I'm up'ing it a star.
author: Roy N.

description: Just tried this yogurt place and loved it! The lychee, pineapple and mango flavors are super flavorful and nice and tart, just the way I like it! All three flavors made it to my cup! Love the flavor selection here and the yogurt is very creamy, you can taste the good quality ingredients. I highly recommend it and will be coming back with the hubby soon.
author: Crystal M.

description:
Alright MoYo's... I can't be extremely harsh to you considering I came here as a part of LivingSocial's #dollarlunchday where I got $7 worth of froyo for a buck and split it between a friend. The froyo is no where close to being the best froyo I've ever had, but it's decent, and will solve any froyo craving. I sampled the watermelon sorbet they had, and it was WAY too sweet. Glad I sampled it before going right ahead and getting it. I thought it'd be at least somewhat similar to Pinkberry's watermelon froyo, but it was completely different. I went with the chocolate and tart mixed together. Decent. I will say they had a pretty rare variety of flavors like taro for example, which was pretty cool.

Their toppings all looked fresh and the area was clean and sanitary looking. Awesome. I hate when froyo places have the toppings spread all over the counter, or mixed in with other toppings, and fruit looks gross and goopy. That wasn't the case here. 

An average experience for me.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I'm such a froyo whore. I see a sign for it and I'm in line with a cup full of goodies before my friends even realize I'm gone. Of course I had to grab a cup here when I spotted it...

I can't ever pass up a chance to try taro, and chose to couple this with original for good measure. The taro is not as good as a spot back in Atlanta, but it was still pretty solid. Slightly tart, fairly sweet. The original was smooth and tangy, though again not the very best I've had but far from the worst.

The toppings is where it gets good. Strawberries and kiwis that taste ripe and fresh? Yes please! There were also these balls that pop in your mouth with a burst of flavor, from strawberry to mango to whatever you choose. Who doesn't like a tasty ball bursting in their mouth?

The cashier was friendly to my boyfriend and I, asking us if we were visiting, what we'd been up to, offering up things he thought we might like to see.

Pretty solid spot and I would come back if I was visiting in the area again.
author: M A.

description:
I came last night with a companion and her nephew because by the time we finished dinner, the other dessert places at the Japan Center (namely the crepe places) were closed. This was still open and we promised dessert for her nephew.

I'm not a frozen yogurt place expert because I've been to very few. I can say (and my companion agreed) that they don't offer many flavor. I believe they have only eight yogurt dispensing handles. During our visit, they don't have what I'd consider unique or standout flavors either (but I did like the lychee and blueberry flavors I got). They were also lacking raisins and dried pineapple as toppings, two of my favorites for frozen yogurt. At least that helped reduce my portion's cost due to less weight.

When we went, they had cups in three colors: blue, green, and pink. Be aware that the blue one is bigger, therefore probably have a small increased weight compared to the other two also.
author: H K.

description:
MoYo's Froyo is a fairly recent frozen yogurt addition to this neighborhood. Only a few month ago, Fraiche was the only option around here. Out of all these places, my favorite is most certainly MoYo's. Why?
1) It is conveniently located in the Japan Center. 
2) Service is phenomenal: everyone who works there is super friendly.
3) The frozen yogurt tastes delicious, many different tastes and new ones every so often.
4) It is cheaper compared to the other places around here.

Check it out if you have a chance. Enjoy.
author: Ismail J.

description:
+ offers flavors that I think are hard to find
+ is fundraising friendly
+ friendly staff
+ good variety of flavor options

This place is close by to where I work and I'm glad I found out about it. MoYo supported MYEEP through fundraising and it's nice to know they support non-profits that provide jobs to high school kids. 

I was a bit bummed to see they charge $ 0.45 per ounce but soon got over it when I saw the flavors. On my first visit they had lychee and today I saw GUAVA! I've never seen guava flavor and it's my favorite flavor for anything:) they also had mango, passion fruit, strawberry, and others. 

They also give you big chunks of toppings which can be bad because it'll just weigh more and you end up paying more. Also, their cups are huge. I was tempted to fill my cup more because it looked awkward that it didn't even fill the bottom completely. Be cautious!
author: Connie C.

description:
I think I will start coming here instead of the crepe place around the corner.
The blueberry and lychee combo was divine.
All of the toppings one could hope for on a stony rainy day.
Mochi, yummm Mochi.
Go there, you won't be disappointed.
author: Ryan R.

description: I come to this place every weekend, love the lychee flavor. The staff is very friendly and the toppings are amazing, mochi all the way!
author: Kauana D.

description: I love this place. It's pretty cheap. All their flavors are really good. I love the pop pops. They just burst in your mouth. I ate my first frozen yogurt there. One of the best! :D TRY IT!
author: Allyson L.

description:
So far the best froyo Ive had. Flavors were good and not overpowering. Toppings bar was clean and wasnt over or under stocked with stuff. 

They can provide a few more flavors tho cuz there were only 8.

Make sure you ask for the 20% off during the happy hour! best part!!!
author: Gordon L.

description: I had my usual half strawberry, half tart flavors under some sprinkles and almond slices topped with a few cherries. It hit the spot!
author: Samantha S.

description:
I swear their cup or bowl or whatever itself already cost you like $3.. with nothing in it. Gf and I only get a little bit yogurt and very few topings, it cost us $4 something. But meh whatever, all frozen yogurt joint always expensive anyway.

Taro, Green Tea, Death by Chocolate, Mango... mix it together ... hows that sound for a snack?
author: Yohann S.

description:
Let's be real people...this place is not the best for enjoying Frozen Yogurt. I think this place has high ratings because of it's location and cute decoration and colors. I came here wondering with an open mind, and left with a bad taste in my mouth. 

I took a couple of sampling cups and tried a good selection of their flavors. 

Lychee: Taste too artificially sweetened, and not enough natural raw lychee flavor...BIG NO! 

Blueberry: By far the WORST tasting out of all their flavors. You know when you have to take those nasty fruit flavored medicine...well imagine a blueberry medicine taste and there you go. 

Green Tea: Does not taste like green tea at all...kind of puzzling.

Mango: This one was okay, but I've had better. 

If you want to enjoy your frozen yogurt, I would suggest going somewhere else. There is a wide selection of places to get decent to good frozen yogurt in the city. This is not one of the places.
author: Nick C.

description:
Oh, why must I live 3000 miles from MoYo's?

My aunt took me here to try the frozen yogurt. I said that I would just share with her in case I didn't like it (some frozen yogurts are too "yogurty" for me). We got the lychee, mango, and pomegranate yogurts with yogurt chips, pomegranate seeds, and pop pops. Boy, was it delicious!

One cup was not enough for the both of us. We went back and we each got our own. I loaded mine with pop pops. They explode in your mouth like salmon roe, except they are fruit-flavored.

Since my aunt was treating me, I opted for the smaller cup size. The yogurt and toppings are self-serve and you pay by weight. If you opt for the large cup size, you can easily make a $20 frozen yogurt.
author: Herman B.

description:
This place is yumaroony! I have been here twice now, and each time the staff has been nothing but friendly. The taro and strawberry froyos were great. They also had cappucino, cookies n cream, lychee, and regular. 

i would say average priced, decent selection of toppings--but WAIT: they have POP POPS!! What are pop pops, you ask? they are little balls of juicy fruity goodness that pop in your mouth! yey! 

p.s. we came after dinner and the "small" cup of yogurt semi filled was too much for us to finish. self-serve and pay by weight.
author: Kat D.

description: This is really nice place to have frozen yogurt ice cream. All flavors are yummy. It's like self-service where you can get ice-cream as little or as much as you want and then choose topping. The price depends on the weight :)
author: Suvida N.

description:
I can never go wrong with froyo, so tried MoYo's for the first time with a friend. 

I asked for some sample cups, then the lady who was working asked what flavors we wanted to try; then she got the sample for my friend and I. I saw the cheapness right there. But as long as their froyo's good, I don't care. 

After filling up my cup with the froyo, I went for the toppings and didn't see any cheese cake cubes. So I asked the lady there if there's any. Then she brought out a tray of some cheesecake cubes and let me add to my cup. Right when I was done adding the cheesecake, I saw a hair in my cup! I picked up that hair and showed her it. I am sure that hair is not mine! o.o   That lady looked at the hair then looked at me with a surprised look. I was expecting an apology from her, but she didn't say anything! My friend was hesitating whether I should get a new cup. Then I finally said, "It's cool, I won't die." 

From the moment I showed the lady that hair to when I left, I did not hear any kinds of apology from her. I am probably not going to go back there again..
author: Pui L.

description:
Has it really been that long since I've been to J-town?  I was surprised to see MoYo's where Cafe Hana used to be.  

Decor: cute, modern, bright colors

Yogurt: Flavors the day I went were: taro, strawberry, lychee, mango, cookies & cream, green tea, blueberry, pomegranate, and original tart.  

Green Tea: I had a sample of this - it was a bit too sweet for my taste
Pomegranate: this was not bad if you like things tart
Lychee: good lychee flavor - more tart than sweet

Toppings: they have a lot of the typical toppings you would find - oreo bits, chocolate, fresh fruits
- Mango and Passionfruit poppers: these are little balls filled with juice that *pops* in your mouth - the lady told me to try it and it was actually quite good! 

Service: the people are friendly, but a bit too pushy...and at Yogurtland they give you sample cups whereas here, the guy asks you what you want to sample and does it for you...I kind of felt like you can't try more than 1...maybe 2.

Side note: the cups were TuttiMelon cups...so maybe MoYo's is really TuttiMelon?
author: Alvina W.

description: The only place I've ever seen Taro froyo or lychee popping boba. My favorite!
author: Karissa W.

description:
I love this yogurt place!

The prices are good and so is the froyo!

My favorite flavor is the taro!

I also like adding almond jelly and the pop pops and the mochi to it!!

The staff here are pretty nice, most especially the owner! She's really awesome! 

Overall, a great place to satisfy your froyo cravings in the area!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I really enjoyed it...the froyo was excellent (we tried 6 flavors) and the topps were clean and fresh. The Asian lady that worked there was really sweet and nice to us. 

The cups are HUGE though!!!!

45 cents per ounce - between the 3 of us we shared over 2 1/2lbs of this yummy goodness! calories?!? What calories?!? It's Froyo! Right?!? At least that's what I'll keep on telling myself! Almost OD on sugar! 

Didn't know about the stampy card or the happy hour discount, but will come back whenever we are in the area!
author: Peter L.

description:
YO YO Mo YO!

As a frequent Japan Town shopper, I'd say that this place is a nice little addition to the bevvy of shops that keep my kids wanting more. Now when we're over they seem to gravitate towards MOYO instantly.

Right across from the Sanrio Store, it's also located close to the entrance from Peace Plaza.  

Froyo is solid. They have a great selection and are very helpful. I appreciate their selection of fresh fruit. 

The manager of the business also seems like a truly  stand up guy - I mean he's offering to donate 20% of each purchase if you mention Rosa Parks Elementary or Jefferson!
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Jennifer wants to give this place a 4 star! So, 4 star it is!! 

I mean I know I can't really judge the taste of froyo because they kind of all taste the same to me. Especially when we get the Original Tart flavor. However, if anyone knows her froyo, it will be Jennifer. She LOVES that stuff. 

I believe we got the original, mango, and taro flavor all in one cup with some fresh fruit toppings and a little bit of mochi!

It was definitely not bad and is a LIFE SAVER in the hot mall since the sun is shining right through the rooftop glass all day heating up the place!

We sat outside at one of the tables provided. Even though it didn't bother us much, I personally wished that the tables are constantly cleaned because our table was kind of dirty. Other than that, I had a great time consuming the frozen yogurt with Jennifer at this place!
author: JenniferIvan L.

description:
I have to agree with Nick C's review. Went there with family and they were raving about the Lychee flavored froyo. The girl went to the back, got a teeny paper cup and put in a small dab of Lychee sample in it . I didn't know they made cups that small. I thought it was kind of sour (yeah froyo, not ice cream). I said, Mango is a favorite flavor ice cream and wondered how the froyo versiion tasted.... but she walked away and was not interested in giving me another sample. I got a spoon and sampled my nephew's green tea from the cup he bought. I couldn't taste anything. I got the smallest (pretty big) cup they offered. I squish in a few inches of Blueberry, Mango, and yeah... Lychee. Maybe more will taste better? I topped in carefully with a few mango and lychee balls. A small spoon of different color mochi squares. I'm careful b/c the sign warns you that it is 45 cents an ounce. The cup itself must weight an ounce. I'm sorry, but the blueberry is nasty. The Lychee was OK with the flavored balls and the Mango was the best. The mochi squares were not worth the sugar or calories. In fact, you can buy a whole bag in Chinatown for a little over a dollar.
My cup came to 6 oz. and My son's was 9 oz. Why did he pick the heavy chunks of watermelon??? Anyway, the 2 little cups came to about $7. It might have been healthier than the ice cream next door but the sugary stuff we added probably took away any nutritional savings. 
I also like frozen yogurt a bit firmer. This melted too quickly. It was Ok... 
The little kids liked being able to choose their own toppings and flavors. The place was very clean.
author: jane f.

description:
Apparently their grand opening is this weekend - glad to have tried this place this early! Not too too many flavors - green tea, lychee, pomegranate, taro, mango, original, strawberry. We only tried the green tea, taro, and lychee. The green tea is sweet - i like it. Taro is nice and lychee is more tart than sweet. 
The toppings!  Personally I don't get frozen yogurt too much, so maybe this is new or maybe i need to get out more: the passion fruit and mango poppers!  They are like water balloons - kind of fun to eat :) Must try. 
The owner (i think) is pretty cool too.
author: MissJ J.

description: Taro, lychee, mango -- who needs toppings? This stuff was absolutely yummy, and I had mine naked. Brought my Minneapolis family to Japantown for some fun shopping. They now have weighable frozen yogurt in the Midwest, but nothing like this. They loved it! And the 5 year old had a blast choosing toppings.
author: Jude M.

description:
It's about time there's a frozen yogurt shop in Japantown! You'd think there would've been one a while ago, when the frozen yogurt craze fad/craze began.

The were only several flavors that I remember, such as chocolate, tart, strawberry, and taro. I tried everything but tart. I liked what I tried though my only complaint is that they're a little on the sweeter side. There's nothing wrong with that, but just something to take into consideration. 

There were a lot of different toppings and everything seemed really neat, clean, and organized. 

I'll most likely come back if I'm ever in the area wanting frozen yogurt. :)
author: K. E.

description: hm...i'm always biased as a hardcore yogurt land fan!  (I mean this place is way more expensive first off).  The yogurt itself has much more of a yogurt taste.  (maybe it was just the flavor I got?).  But it grew on me.  Brownie points for having lots of fruits for toppings, such as pomegranate seeds (haven't seen that at a yogurt place before).
author: Tiffany C.

description: Great little froyo place in Japantown - not sure why SF has so few good froyo places, but this one is worth the parking hassles in Japantown! Try the lychee, mango, and green tea flavors. Friendly lady (owner?) who doesn't make faces when you ask for a taste of different flavors. Slightly more expensive ($0.45/oz) compared to froyo places in Palo Alto, but I guess you pay a bit more for the location.
author: Shweta V.

description: I like the flavors this place has. Especially the Taro. I think they need more toppings. Also you need a five dollar minimum to use your credit card. Or you have a fee. I really don't like that.
author: M L.

description: I'm a fan of the taro and chocolate flavors, which were nice and creamy, although a bit sweet after a few spoonfuls.  I'll probably drop in once in a while when I'm in the mood for flavors that Fraiche doesn't offer, but I do have to say it was a bit strange that I wasn't allowed to sample flavors on my own.  It felt odd to have someone staring at me while I was trying the two small samples!  Otherwise the service was fine.
author: Janet L.

description: Good yogurt and above-average toppings, but the sampling experience is diminished by the fact that the clerk has to leave her post to begrudingly hand-serve samples. Self-serve would be far better. The froyo taste is above average, but there were only 6 flavors. The website made it seems like there would be far more. Price seems about average.
author: Zack F.

description: I'm glad that there's finally a self-srve froyo place in JTown.  The original is nice and tart.  What really makes it stand out are the added  "Pop"  toppings.  Pops are these little round balls that just burst with flavor in your mouth.  It's a great dessert place to stop by after eating lunch or dinner in the area.
author: Stacey L.

description: Delicious taro frozen yogurt, but the lady working there was rude, on her phone the whole time and wouldn't let me try more than one sample.
author: Milla K.

description: Small place, not extremely well-lit. The yogurt flavors are pretty good (I think there was a berry one that tasted super awesome). There are so many toppings you can add which is great even though some of them don't look too fresh. Reasonably priced. Cute spoons add a nice touch.
author: Idk A.

description: This place is awesome. You can put whatever you want and just pay by weight. And the flavors are really really good. Highly recommended!
author: Paolo I.

description: This place has good Asian flavors, but half are artificial and there are very few flavors.  Toppings are overpriced but the price/oz is more or less normal (45 cents/oz)
author: Ethan C.

description: Great toppings and great yogurt! Reasonably priced too. This is my fav fro yo place in SF!
author: Ashley M.

description: I had to spend 5 dollars to use my card. I didn't realize that trying to use 5 dollars would be so hard! ( in this case it's a good thing) my yogurt was sky high and topped with everything imaginable! I def will be coming back for dessert and a bang for my buck!
author: Deanna W.

description:
mmmmmmmmmm froyo! 

remember to get their stampy card too!
author: Valerie N.

description:
oh i SO love this froyo place!!  for me this place has THE best yogurt ever.  better than my local yogurtland and pinkberry.  i had the chocolate with graham crackers and sliced almonds, HEAVEN!

i've also had the mango flavored froyo with fresh strawberry slices, and omigawwwd, that was absolute heaven as well.

the best part about this moyo's froyo place though (which is also tutti frutti), is that there is a pleasantly relaxing koi fish pond right in front of the yogurt shop, which is clear and you can see all the coins at the bottom of the fish pond.  it's just so relaxing - and the sun shining through the top of the japantown building.  makes for a nice afternoon treat really.

the price is perfect too - fairly inexpensive for a nice low cal dessert right?  i'll be back here.  i'll be back... ;)
author: Nine N.

description:
Good varieties, my fave was mango FroYo, with mochi and that watery boba thing that I had fun popping in my mouth :)

It's pretty pricey, but the lady who served us was very nice and gave me punch card. I think they should provide smaller cup, the smallest they have was an XL cup
author: Sendy K.

description: Read about this place here on yelp before my vacation. I really wanted to stop by and I got the chance to my first day in town! It's definitely different than any other self serve FroYo I've been to, but I really loved the Lychee yogurt with all the fun funky toppings that they have. I will definitely stop by again before my trip is over. SO YUMMY!
author: Suzy R.

description: The best frozen yogurt in the Bay Area.  Be sure to try Papaya one (unique flavor that's hard to find in other places) and almond tofu for the topping.
author: Charles S.

description: Love their original tart, lychee, mango, and strawberry yogurt. The fruit is very fresh, and there are a variety of toppings. Everyone who works there is super friendly. Read some reviews where people complained about not getting enough sample tastings, but the flavors are pretty straight forward. It's not like basket robbins 31 ice cream where you're not sure if you'll like the flavor or not... If you get strawberry frozen yogurt, you're getting strawberry frozen yogurt.
author: Christine C.

description: Not bad , not bad . I was surprised to see a yogurt shop open up in Japantown but I'm glad it did . The yogurt here is decent . The strawberry and blueberry are pretty good . The green tea is alright . I didn't really like the taro ... it was kind of bland . I really liked their selection of toppings . Their mango and passion fruit poppers were both very good . I forgot what else they had but they had a good , wide selection . The worker here was very friendly too .
author: Eileen L.

description: it been about a few year since i came back here. i come to this place after eating sushi with the gal and they wanted some dessert. i told them there is a great froyo in the mall  and man  it seem like that they have change the  management or something . they still play the same movie. but they topping isn't as fresh as before. i remember  there was two younger guy in there that made me laugh. i remember that they made me try on different  sample and topping  and make funny jokest. now it quiet and boring. their favor are almost the same. idk it doesn't feel like froyo anymore. there isnt any good vibe to that place anymore.
author: janet l.

description: I love frozen yogurt but am picky with where I get it. Not too sweet and definitely not too sour. I love Moyos for the great flavors and topping choices but what is even more outstanding is there awesome customer service. They recognize me when I come in there (which ok, I admit, is often) and they always ask me how I am, chat with me, and even crack jokes. They are ecstatic about their product and it shows. They have explained flavors, given me samples, and compared their toppings to techno beats in your mouth. What could be better? :) love you moyos and I'll be back soon.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: My 1st frozen yogurt w/an array of different flavors.  I took the small cup just to sample it and combined taro + green tea then added pop balls lychee.  It was great, i'd come back again to try the other varieties.
author: Maripet M.

description: The first time I tried Moyo's I was absolutely blown away. I think I tried it when they first opened since I go to Japantown a lot. So I believe I tried a mix of strawberry, mango and green tea yogurt. They had a great selection of toppings. The strawberries looked like they were freshly picked. The pop-pops were great. It's like eating a water balloon. I will admit, it is somewhat more expensive than Nubi's, but I like Moyo's better. The service is great. The people who work there are so friendly, it's like they greet you as if you are their friend. Like, "Oh! It's nice seeing you again." But then again, maybe it's because I went there almost everyday for a week. It's just that good. It's good how they rotate their flavors, but I am glad they don't take our strawberry, not only it's sugar free, but it tastes like candy! I always take my friends there, they have a stamp card thing, and it doesn't take a long time to fill it . It took me three months to finish it, but it takes me about 7 visits. I can get 10 ounces easily. My record is 17.7 ounces. I love moyos!
author: Cynthia D.
